comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Similar photo in The evening world., December 28, 1915, Final Edition, Image 3, taken on board of the steamship New York: "Had Rough Time on the Atlantic, But Smallest Dog Survived It". Anthony Joseph Drexel, Jr (Oct. 19, 1887 - Feb. 23, 1946) Financier. World War I Soldier. Aviator. (www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=14193320) He was the son of Anthony Joseph Drexel (1865–1934) and the grandson of Anthony Joseph Drexel (September 13, 1826 — June 30, 1893), who founded Drexel, Morgan & Co (later J.P. Morgan & Co.) in 1871 (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anthony_Joseph_Drexel) Mrs. Drexel was the former Miss Marjorie Gould (www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=7811758), more photos of her:

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: B-59: Thanks for fleshing out the story of the Drexels. It's always helpful to see the photo (or similar) used in a newspaper as well. Chronicling America is a great resource!
